stems: keep your eye on the ball
the ball is in your court

def: {bc} a usually round object that is used in a game or sport or as a toy
{bc} something that has a round shape
{bc} a round bullet shot out of an old-fashioned gun

dt: {bc}a usually round object that is used in a game or sport or as a toy

dt.t: a tennis/soccer {it}ball{/it}
golf/billiard/bowling {it}balls{/it}
a toy rubber {it}ball{/it}
kick/throw/hit/catch/bounce/dribble the {it}ball{/it}
a {it}ball{/it} of string
She uses cotton {it}balls{/it} to clean her face.
eating rice/melon {it}balls{/it}

dt: {bc}a round bullet shot out of an old-fashioned gun
{bc}the rounded part of the human foot that is at the bottom of the foot and behind the toes

dt.t: He stood on the {it}balls{/it} of his feet.
She kicked him in the {it}balls{/it}.

dt: {bc}the courage that is needed to do something

dt.t: You don't have the/enough {it}balls{/it} [={it}guts{/it}, {it}nerve{/it}] to fight me.

dt: often used as an interjection to express disapproval or annoyance
{bc}a ball that is thrown or hit

dt.t: She hit a high arching {it}ball{/it} over the net.
I thought the {it}ball{/it} [=serve] was good, but my opponent said it was out.

dt: {dx}see also {dxt|air ball||} {dxt|curveball||} {dxt|fastball||} {dxt|fly ball||} {dxt|ground ball||} {it}fair ball{/it} at {dxt|fair:1||} {it}foul ball{/it} at {dxt|foul:1||}{/dx}
{bc}a pitch that does not go through the proper area and that the batter does not swing at

dt.t: The first pitch was a {it}ball{/it} but the next two pitches were strikes.

dt: {bc}to have the responsibility for doing something

dt.t: No one else is available to make the arrangements, so it's up to you to {it}carry the ball{/it}.

dt: {bc}to make a mistake especially by not doing something important

dt.t: I think the mayor {it}dropped the ball{/it} by not hiring more police officers.
She tried to {it}get the ball rolling{/it} by asking him a few questions.

dt: {bc}to cause an activity or process to continue

dt.t: I've started the preparations for the party, but it's up to you to {it}keep the ball rolling{/it}.

dros.drp: keep your eye on the ball

dt: {bc}to continue thinking about or giving attention to something important that you want to do or achieve

dt.t: She really needs to {it}keep her eye on the ball{/it} [=stay focused] if she wants to win the election.

dt: {bc}mentally prepared {bc}aware of what is happening and ready to do what is needed or wanted

dt.t: With so many intelligent students, the teacher must always be {it}on the ball{/it}.
Their lawyer was really {it}on the ball{/it}.

dt: {bc}to begin or continue to play a game with a ball (such as baseball)

dt.t: {ldquo}Let's {it}play ball{/it}!{rdquo} shouted the umpire.
We went outside to {it}play{/it} some {it}ball{/it}.

dt: {bc}to do what other people want you to do {bc}to cooperate or work with other people

dt.t: He refused to {it}play ball{/it} with the police.

dros.drp: the ball is in your court

dt: If {it}the ball is in your court{/it}, you are the person who is expected or required to do something.

dt.t: What do you think we should do now? {it}The ball is in your court{/it}.
She's waiting for {it}the ball to be in her court{/it}.

shortdef: a usually round object that is used in a game or sport or as a toy
something that has a round shape
a round bullet shot out of an old-fashioned gun

dt.t: I stood up quickly and {it}balled{/it} my hands into fists.
He {it}balled{/it} the letter in his hands and threw it in the trash.
He {it}balled up{/it} the letter and threw it in the trash.
His clothes were {it}balled up{/it} on the floor.
She lay in bed {it}balled up{/it} [={it}curled up{/it}] under the blankets.

shortdef: to form (something) into a ball —often + up

def: {bc} a large formal party for dancing

dt.t: Cinderella went to the {it}ball{/it} and danced with the prince.
They were invited to the governor's {it}ball{/it}.

dt: {bc}to have fun {bc}to spend time in a very enjoyable way

dt.t: Everyone {it}had a ball{/it} at the party.

shortdef: a large formal party for dancing

def: {bc} something that limits someone's freedom or ability to do things

dt: {bc}something that limits someone's freedom or ability to do things

dt.t: Drugs are a {it}ball and chain{/it} for many people.
({it}old-fashioned{/it}) He referred to his wife as {ldquo}the {it}ball and chain{/it}.{rdquo}

shortdef: something that limits someone's freedom or ability to do things

def: {bc} a part of a machine in which another part (such as a metal pole) turns easily
{bc} one of the balls in a ball bearing

dt: {bc}a part of a machine in which another part (such as a metal pole) turns easily
A ball bearing is made up of several small metal balls that fit between two metal rings.
{bc}one of the balls in a ball bearing

shortdef: a part of a machine in which another part (such as a metal pole) turns easily
one of the balls in a ball bearing

def: {bc} a boy who picks up balls that go out of play during a game in tennis, baseball, etc.

dt: {bc}a boy who picks up balls that go out of play during a game in tennis, baseball, etc.

shortdef: a boy who picks up balls that go out of play during a game in tennis, baseball, etc.

def: {bc} any game that is played with a ball
{it}informal{/it} used in phrases like {phrase}a whole new ball game{/phrase} and {phrase}a different ball game{/phrase} to describe a situation or activity that has changed

dt: {bc}any game that is played with a ball

dt.t: He was popular because he was good at {it}ball games{/it}.
Dad took us to a {it}ball game{/it}.
watching a {it}ball game{/it} on TV

dt: used in phrases like {phrase}a whole new ball game{/phrase} and {phrase}a different ball game{/phrase} to describe a situation or activity that has changed

dt.t: The sport of car racing is {it}a whole new ball game{/it}.
Raising children is {it}a different ball game{/it} now.

shortdef: any game that is played with a ball
—used in phrases like a whole new ball game and a different ball game to describe a situation or activity that has changed

def: {bc} a girl who picks up balls that go out of play during a game in tennis, baseball, etc.

dt: {bc}a girl who picks up balls that go out of play during a game in tennis, baseball, etc.

shortdef: a girl who picks up balls that go out of play during a game in tennis, baseball, etc.

def: {it}chiefly US{/it}, {it}informal{/it} {bc} a person who is very active and has a lot of energy

dt: {bc}a person who is very active and has a lot of energy

dt.t: That guy is a real {it}ball of fire{/it}.

shortdef: a person who is very active and has a lot of energy

def: {bc} a situation or set of conditions
{bc} a collection of items or objects

dt.t: He's a good amateur, but playing basketball at the professional level is an entirely different {it}ball of wax{/it}. [=an entirely different thing]
He won the car, the furniture, and the tropical vacation—the {phrase}whole ball of wax{/phrase}! [={it}everything{/it}]

shortdef: a situation or set of conditions
a collection of items or objects
